pages.title: Cloning
pages.text: <thing>Cloning/$ is a major automatable production path in <thing>$(l:essentials:intro/path#witchcraft)witchcraft/$ which allows cheaply mass-producing almost any mob (other than bosses, configurable), and creating custom-variants with buffs, debuffs, or special traits.$(br2)Potential applications for cloning include:
Mass-production of rare mob drops, creating large numbers of super-strong tamed pets, creating better mounts, and more.$(br2)

The following special <thing>traits/$ can be given to clones:$(br2)<em>Respawning:/$ Respawning clones will respawn at full health in the same location, 30 seconds (config) after dying. They respawn with weakness, glowing, and <thing>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/souls#transient)soul transience/$ for 30 seconds (config). If they die with <thing>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/souls#transient)soul transience/$ they won't respawn, but can respawn an unlimited number

of times other than that. They always give mob drops, even if they respawn- making them ideal for farming.$(br2)<em>Imprinting:/$ Imprinting clones will never despawn naturally. Also, if they're a tamable mob (ex. wolves or horses), they will spawn pre-tamed; they can either be designed to be pre-tamed by a specific player, or to whichever player

spawns them. If they were spawned by a machine (ex. dispenser) and were designed to tame to the player who spawned them, they won't be pre-tamed, but still won't despawn.$(br2)<em>Potions:/$ Clones can have permanent potion effects that will never expire, such as fire resistance or regeneration. This can include debuffs if you want to make them easier

All clones have <thing>degradation/$. A perfect clone will have 0 <thing>degradation/$, but errors or inefficiencies in the production process will cause clones to have <thing>degradation/$, reducing maximum health by 1 heart (configurable) for each point of <thing>degradation/$. Clones of clones will carry-over the <thing>degradation/$ from the previous iteration.$(br2)

<thing>Cloning/$ starts with using a <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/syringe)syringe/$ to take a <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/syringe#blood)blood sample/$ from the mob being <thing>cloned/$. The <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/syringe#blood)blood sample/$ will <thing>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/spoilage)spoil/$ if not used quickly enough, and using a <thing>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/spoilage)spoiled/$ <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/syringe#blood)blood sample/$ causes 1 point of <thing>degradation/$.$(br2)The <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/syringe#blood)blood sample/$ needs to be processed in a <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/blood_centrifuge)blood centrifuge/$ to create a <item>centrifuged blood sample/$, which can also <thing>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/spoilage)spoil/$. If the <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/blood_centrifuge)blood

<item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/blood_centrifuge)centrifuge/$ setup is flawed, it can cause additional <thing>degradation/$.$(br2)The <item>centrifuged blood sample/$ is used to create the first <item>embryo/$. After the first <item>embryo/$ is created, it can be easily duplicated in a <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/cultivator_vat)nutrition vat/$ without needing more <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/syringe#blood)blood samples/$.$(br2)The first <item>embryo/$ is created in a <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/embryo_lab)Miller-Urey

<item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/embryo_lab)capsule/$, where it can be customized to add <thing>traits/$.$(br2)<item>Embryos/$ <thing>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/spoilage)spoil/$ after 30minutes, and will be damaged by being <thing>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/spoilage)frozen/$, increasing <thing>degradation/$ by one point on them and any copied <item>embryos/$. Instead, they can be preserved using a <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/cultivator_vat)nutrition vat/$, where they can also be duplicated. <thing>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/spoilage)Spoiled/$ <item>embryos/$ are worthless, and can't be duplicated or turned

into clones.$(br2)Finally, the <item>embryo/$ is made into a <item>spawn egg/$ for the final cloned mob, using an <item>$(l:essentials:witchcraft/incubator)incubator/$. These <item>spawn eggs/$ can be used by hand or by dispensers.$(br2)
